data.scheme_name: Scheme of Term Loan Assistance To Qualified Professionals - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides loan assistance upto Rs.75 lakhs for setting up new or acquiring additional fixed assets for professional practice / consultancy venture.
data.eligibility:
1. All professionals such as doctors, IT professionals, CAs, architects, lawyers, engineers, etc. in the individual/joint capacity or as a partnership concern/LLP/Company. 
  2. The age of the applicant should be up to 55 years at the time of application.
data.conditions:
1. The promoter/applicant must have at least two years of experience in their respective professional field. 
  2. Loan Use: Creation of fixed assets or repayment of standard loans. 
  3. Mortgage Conditions: Property must not be leased/rented without Corporation’s permission. 
  4. Satisfactory repayment history and dealings with the Corporation, banks, or financial institutions.
data.beneficiaries:
Following Professionals in the individual/joint capacity or as a partnership concern/LLP/Company are eligible under this scheme: 

  1. Registered Medical Practitioners and Doctors in Homeopathy, Ayurvedic, Veterinary, Dentists including Physiotherapist, Pharmacist, IT professionals, Chartered Accountants, Company Secretaries, Advocates, Consulting Engineers, Chartered Engineers / Registered Valuers, Architects, Cost Accountants, MBA, MMS, MCA, BTech, Bachelor in Fashion Designing, Interior Designing, Hotel Management, Psychology, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data Analytics, etc. 
  2. The age of the applicant should be up to 55 years at the time of application.
data.prerequisites:
1. The promoter/applicant must have at least two years of experience in their respective professional field. 
  2. Loan Use: Creation of fixed assets or repayment of standard loans. 
  3. Mortgage Conditions: Property must not be leased/rented without Corporation’s permission. 
  4. Satisfactory repayment history and dealings with the Corporation, banks, or financial institutions.
data.context: To provide financial assistance to finance acquisition of premises, machinery and furniture & fixtures required for setting up new or acquiring additional fixed assets for professional practice / consultancy venture.
data.objective: The support is aimed at helping professionals set up new or expand existing fixed assets for their professional practice or consultancy ventures.
data.description:
1. Scheme provides loan assistance of up to Rs. 75 lakhs, repayable within 8 years including moratorium period up to 2 years. 
  2. Term Loan Interest Rate: 9.50% p.a. (floating) The minimum promoter’s contribution shall be 25% of the project cost.
data.funding_mechanism:
1. The loan shall be disbursed after execution of legal documents and compliance of terms of sanction/ disbursement formalities. 
  2. The loan disbursement shall be in proportion to the investment made on land, building, machinery etc. and as per other terms and conditions governing the sanction.
data.additional_info:
1. Security: The loan must have at least 100% immovable security coverage, with a first charge on financed assets (land, building, machinery). 
  2. Additional collateral may include commercial or residential non-agricultural properties, or other acceptable securities. 
  3. Personal guarantees may be required from promoters, directors, or suitable individuals. Processing Fees: 1% of the loan amount, up to Rs. 2 lakhs + Service Tax . 
  4. Preliminary fee: Rs. 0.10 lakhs + GST. Fees are non-refundable.
data.checklist_info_a:
Detailed Project Report
Land Records
Business proof
Term Loan Application Form
Certificate/Declaration
Biodata of the promoter/Partner/Director/Guarantor
Ownership documents of Primary, Additional  & Collateral Securities
Documents pertaining to Building / Civil works
Details of machinery proposed to be acquired
Last three years Income Tax Returns
Applicants bank details
Net worth certificate listing assets & liabilities with location details issued by Chartered Accountant (for loans above `50.00 lakhs)
Documents to be submitted post sanction of loan:
NOC from Goa IDC for land in industrial estates 
Income Tax Clearance under section 281 (1) (ii) of the Income Tax Act,1961
In case of companies:
Board Resolution
Consent letters from Directors to furnish their Personal Guarantee
Any other documents as stipulated in the Sanction Letter.
data.beneficiary: Specific Industry - Proprietorship, Partnership, Public Company, Private Limited Company, Limited Liability Partnership - Goa - All MSME and All Non-MSME
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
